dialogue: I know what you're here for. The Orb of the all powerful Daimaou, am I correct? I simply wish to have a discussion with you rather than have this conversation devolve into barbarity.
As you can clearly see, I did not allow my domain degenerate like the other Heavenly Kings. I wielded both the power of the Orb and my own power to create the only haven on this cursed land.
Tell me, have the Blue told you what these Orbs are? Your Progenitors? The voice that guided you here? Have they told you what it is they've sent you through the jaws of death to retrieve.
That gormless look on your face serves as enough of an answer. Tell me, are you a believer in the Daimaou or in the Blue?
So thus, I raise you a proposition.
It is with the power of the Orbs alone that I have been able to create such a beautiful country.
With just one, I was able to turn the cursed, ruined land of the Southern Domain into my paradise.
Sacrifices are necessary to maintain my demonic power, but the people give. Willingly, knowing it is for the sake of their brethren and prosperity.
As such, great Warrior, I offer you a covenant. I will give you my orb without word or struggle, and you will carry on the will of Paradise.
With all four orbs in our possession we can strip this world of all demonic influence, and guide humanity to its future.
So, do you share my dream?
And what is it exactly that you believe in? His strength? His rule? His riches? I'm not like your masters, remnant. I'm willing to share my knowledge with you.
The Daimaou you've heard of is but one of many. An endless cycle of mutiny, violence and distrust. Each Daimaou a victim of the next.
Trying to build a sensible society on a foundation like that is like trying to grow rice in the desert. One mad god after another.
The Daimaou didn't 'vanish'. He was killed. Most likely. This is just a working theory, but it is not unfounded.
The inevitability is an even more terrible demon taking his throne. There is no redemption coming for the people of this country. No redemption asides from me.
Why? You have no real allegiance to them. They're the glimmering remnants of old mankind, and you're a mannequin dancing to their swansong.
Humans in my domain thrive beyond measure, without fear of subjugation by demons. They have no need for the endless crusade for power.
My sources even yet tell me that the Blue are locked in conflict with the Ashura-O. If that brainless thing is able to accumulate enough power he could very well become the next Daimaou.
He is strong enough to do that, that alone should tell you the fate of your masters.
She seems genuinely taken aback by your answer.
You've fallen for the sweet lies of an angel so easily. You really are human, through and through.
Beautifully, painfully innocent. You see, don't you? I'm the only hope mankind has at anything resembling peace.
Structure, protection, and most importantly, belief. All ideals needed for mankind to thrive.
Naturally, you are not from this world. Your allegiances yet lie with none.
The Daimaou's madness pales in comparison to the paradise I have created.
An ideal habitat for humans. Safe, fruitful, simple. No wars, no plague, no jealousy, no hate, most importantly no demons.
A world where everyone knows their place from birth. A kind, peaceful place where mankind has no reason to tear one another apart.
Such a world makes more sense than this one.
It will be a dangerous path, filled with a great many perils and distractions.
But know that I will always be with you, my champion.
Such a world is the dream of a tyrant.
Ah, I'd really thought you'd seen it my way. What a tragedy, my champion. If you will oppose me then I have no choice.
I'll have to sate my dissapointment with the taste of your flesh.
